column4: I have a ubuntu server setup with software raid1. Will I be warned in any way if a disk goes down? Will the machine stop working until the broken disk is replaced?
the point of RAID1 is to be an exact copy.. so no it wont go down
How will I be warned then?
it's not a raid card, it's software raid
raid cards beep and won't let you boot unless you override it
ugh... that's odd. The system should just hang up at boot time and let you ssh in in order for you to acknowledge and either keep using it or power it down.
not sure why ur system isnt staying operational to be honest
oh I didn't say it wasn't operational. I personally don't want it to work if raid is degraded. That would be enough of a warning for me to figure it out and fix it before the 2nd drive fails
i suppose it depends on the situation my servers are mission critical so we dont want downtime
if you reboot a server anyways, you'd be expecting some downtime. Or maybe you're behind a load balancer and you can bounce them one by one. Always depends on the situation.
we never reboot so i dunno
if it's so mission critical, I really hope you're behind a load balancer and have redundancy.
I agree, but booting a degraded array should warn you somehow. Maybe require you to ssh
well the raid card displays on the BIOS if the raid is degraded
it often sends email through the driver
